Description: Eighty cotton (Gossypium hirsutum L.) plants were grown for 38 days under a treatment combination of ambient or elevated temperature (28/17?C or 32/21?C) and ambient (400 ?L L-1) or elevated [CO2] (640 ?L L-1).  Throughout treatments, plants were watered to full field capacity.
All leaves were placed in a leaf area meter.
Height was measured as the vertical distance from the pot surface to the highest apex.
All stems, leaves and roots were destructively harvested 38 days after planting, and dried for 1 week at 70degreesC.
